thread.title: Graeme Souness slams "tippy tappy" Manchester City after Everton humiliation - 'there is something missing'
thread.title_full: Graeme Souness slams "tippy tappy" Manchester City after Everton humiliation - 'there is something missing'

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Graeme Souness slams "tippy tappy" Manchester City after Everton humiliation - 'there is something missing'
text:
Manchester City's players trudge off at Goodison (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get football   Could   
Graeme Souness let rip at Manchester City after their humiliating defeat at Everton. 
Pep Guardiola's men were thumped 4-0 at Goodison Park , to leave them 10 points adrift of Premier League leaders Chelsea. 
City dominated possession throughout but fell behind in the first-half as Romelu Lukaku beat Claudio Bravo. 
Kevin Mirallas added a second straight after the break before late goals from youngsters Tom Davies and Ademola Lookman, as City fell apart. 
And Souness hit out at the visitors and indicated they need to change their approach. Raheem Sterling cuts a frustrated figure (Photo: Alex Livesey) David Silva and Yaya Toure react (Photo: Getty) Pablo Zabaleta in action (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) 
"City were a tippy tappy outfit from start to finish, they’ve got great forward players but there’s something missing," he said on Sky Sports. 
"When you look at the central midfield, Zabaleta is 32, Yaya Toure close to 34 years old, that’s your engine room. 
"You have to have piles and piles of enthusiasm and energy in there. They didn’t have it. Yeah they had lots of the ball, tippy tappy, but they didn’t do a lot with it." Everton's Ademola Lookman celebrates scoring (Photo: Reuters) Pep Guardiola looks on at Goodison (Photo: Getty) Souness in the Sky Sports studio (Photo: Sky Sports/Getty) Read More Everton 4-0 City player ratings: Who was YOUR man of the match? 
The defeat is Pep Guardiola's biggest ever in a league match and the Spaniard admitted it was not the first time his side had suffered, despite controlling possession. 
"The consequence of the game is an example of many that has happened this season. It is football. 
"In football you sometimes don't need to do many things to score. They arrive once and score a goal. It is not today it is almost all the season and it is tough for the players to handle that situation. 
"Of course we can do better. It is awful for my players. It is normal to live these kind of situations sometimes." poll loading Will Manchester City win silverware this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
